Pre-Game Insights: Lithuania and Cyprus will face off in the 2024 UEFA Nations League at the Darius and Girėnas Stadium on September 6, 2024.
Lithuania lost to Estonia in the Baltic Cup final on June 11, 2024, after a 1-1 draw and penalties.
Lithuania secured a 2-0 aggregate victory over Gibraltar in the League C relegation playoff in March 2024.
Cyprus thrashed San Marino 4-1 in a friendly match on June 11, 2024.
Cyprus finished last in Group 2 of League C in the 2022 Nations League, picking up just five points from a possible 18.
Lithuania have won all but one of their last four competitive matches, with the exception being a penalty-shootout defeat against Estonia in June’s Baltic Cup final.
Cyprus have lost their last nine competitive matches, conceding 33 goals and scoring just four since a 1-0 victory over Greece in September 2022.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cyprus boast a superior record in the history of this fixture with three wins from the last four meetings.
Lithuania have picked up one win in their last four meetings with Cyprus, which came in February 2001 when they won 2-1 in Limassol.
